sentence.text: I never thought it 'd make so much difference , " she gabbled .
No , thanks Andy , but I 'd much rather not , " he gabbled .
Fighting down a wave of combined anger and panic , she found herself gabbling furiously , ` I 'm sorry !
Turning towards him , she gabbled , “ Feargal , I … ”
See you again , " she gabbled , and strode away .
` I 'm going back to the mill , " gabbled Evelyn .
` I 'll tell you something , " gabbles Robert enthusiastically , ` There 's no-one out there now whose doorstep I 'd be willing to kip on just to get their autograph .
It 's as if we are gabbling the end of a play we are in .
The representatives of nations and organizations that had been preserving a cautious neutrality now swelled the flock , gabbling about friendly relations and mutual benefit .
Gabbling a canticle as he tore loose a bundle of eerie fetishes knotted from dried ligament , Juron undogged that door .
A presenter who gabbled the Hampshire score switched over to John Arlott at Bournemouth for an update .
When he 'd said , ` Do n't be absurd , you know you have to , " she had almost gabbled Meg 's name like a lucky charm .
Relieved at having thought of something to say , Joseph gabbled his small talk in a rush of unpractised French , stumbling here and there over his pronunciation .
He gabbled all the way to the police station about his favourite film noirs .
Leila threw herself on Quincx , gabbling about what happened .
In the other boat , the priest had started gabbling in Latin -- the Dies Irae , by the sound of it .
Gabriel nodded furiously and gabbled with relief : ` It was no good pleading with him .
I gabbled for a second as shock and rage choked my words .
While she gabbled on Spittals stopped rubbing his hands and , with his eyes on the demented fly , expressed disbelief by taking off his jacket and cradling his head in his hands .
` I suppose you 're planning to make me foam at the mouth and gabble in obsolete tongues . "
He was stocky , bald , and invariably gabbled in an incomprehensible West of Scotland accent .
“ You were gabbling on .
The captain of the guard led them on to the scaffold , a scrawny-faced clerk gabbled out the sentence of the court .
He continued to gabble away under his breath and the ladies returned to their gossip .
You were gabbling on about lizards and turtles and Australia and whales .
Nicola talked most , gabbling on about the tedium of this final year at Oxford , how cold it was in the bedrooms of South Park Road , and the personification of virtue that was Emily .
Very sensible of Hilda : nothing is more ridiculous than an old-age pensioner gabbling on about his or her risqué past .

Agnes began to cry , quietly at first , then it mounted into sobs , then almost into hysteria and in it she gabbled out incoherently to the three gaping sisters what had transpired from the time she had taken the linen across to the house .
The old woman gabbled again but Simon did not translate .
She was gabbling nervously , she realised , gradually petering to a halt as the implacable dark face did n't register any reaction whatsoever .
She was gabbling now .
O'Neill was gabbling and the conversation was running away like a driverless express .
She gabbled : I do n't like the dark .
` I 'm turning it down ! " the man was gabbling .
